text.p: Consider the following vectors in [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline].
Is [mathjaxinline]u[/mathjaxinline] an element of [mathjaxinline]\mathrm{Span}\{ v_1; v_2\}[/mathjaxinline]?
Is [mathjaxinline]w[/mathjaxinline] an element of [mathjaxinline]\mathrm{Span}\{ v_1; v_2\}[/mathjaxinline]?
Is every vector in [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline] an element of [mathjaxinline]\mathrm{Span}\{ v_1; v_2\}[/mathjaxinline]?
Does the list [mathjaxinline]\{ v_1; v_2\}[/mathjaxinline] span [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline]?

font.p: From the parallelogram grid, we can see that [mathjaxinline]u = -2v_1 - 2v_2[/mathjaxinline] and [mathjaxinline]w = 2v_1 + 4v_2[/mathjaxinline], so both are in the span of [mathjaxinline]\{ v_1;v_2\}[/mathjaxinline]. Indeed, every vector in [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline] will be somewhere on this grid, and therefore will be in [mathjaxinline]\mathrm{Span}\{ v_1;v_2\}[/mathjaxinline]. Therefore this list spans [mathjaxinline]\mathbb R^2[/mathjaxinline].
